{{Infobox rail line |name = Nangang Line
åæ¸¯ç· |image = Platform of Blue Line in Taipei City Hall MRT Station 20101211.JPG |caption = [[Taipei City Hall Station]] platform |type = [[Rapid transit]] |locale = [[Taipei]], [[Republic of China]] |start = [[Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center Station|Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center]] |end = [[Ximen Station|Ximen]] |stations = 12 |open = December 24, 1999 |operator = [[Taipei Rapid Transit System]] |character = Underground |depot = Nangang Depot |linelength = {{convert|12.5|km|mi|1|abbr=on|lk=on}} |notrack = 2 |gauge = {{RailGauge|sg}} |speed = 80 km/h |el = [[Third rail]] (750 [[volt]]s [[Direct Current|DC]]) |map = {{Infobox rdt|Nangang Line (TRTS) RDT|navbar=1}} }} {{Chinese|t=åæ¸¯ç·|p=NÃ¡ngÇng-XiÃ n|tp=NÃ¡ngÇng-SiÃ n|w=Nan2-kang3-Hsien4|poj=LÃ¢m-kÃ³ng-SÃ²aâ¿}} The '''Taipei Metro Nangang Line''' ({{zh|t=åæ¸¯ç·}}) is a high-capacity, underground rapid transit line on the [[Taipei Rapid Transit System|Taipei Metro]] in [[Taipei]], [[Taiwan]]. It has 12 stations, is {{convert|12.5|km|mi|abbr=on}}-long and runs east-west through downtown starting in [[Zhongzheng District|Zhongzheng]] and ending in [[Nangang District, Taipei|Nangang]], Taipei. It is part of the [[Blue Line (TRTS)|Blue Line]] and connects to the [[Banqiao Line (TRTS)|Banqiao Line]] and onwards to the [[Tucheng Line (TRTS)|Tucheng Line]]. ==Overview== The {{convert|1.5|km|mi|abbr=on}} Nangang Eastern Extension to [[Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center Station|Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center]] is currently under construction, with the segment to [[Nangang Station|Nangang]] already complete. When the Eastern Extension is completed, traveling time from [[Nangang Software Park Station|Nangang Software Park]] to [[Taipei Main Station]] will be reduced from 34 minutes to 18 minutes.{{cite web | url=http://www.dorts.gov.tw/public/Attachment/9101511111652.pdf | title=æ·éç³»çµ±åæ¸¯æ±å»¶æ®µç°¡ä» | publisher= ''Taipei Rapid Transit Corporation'' | date=2009-07-04 | accessdate=2009-07-19 }} Due to [[Taipei City Hall Station]] being at the center of the [[Taipei 101]] New Year's festivities, intervals between trains can be reduced to a minimum of 135 seconds, transporting up to 39,000 passengers per hour.{{cite news|url=http://www.chinapost.com.tw/taiwan/local/taipei/2010/12/23/284807/Taipei-City.htm|title=Taipei City promises faster New Year MRT|publisher=The China Post|date=2010-12-23|accessdate=2010-12-23}} ==History== *December 24, 1999: The [[Taipei City Hall Station|Taipei City Hall]]-[[Ximen Station|Ximen]] segment began service.{{cite web | url=http://english.dorts.taipei.gov.tw/ct.asp?xItem=205657&ctNode=19582&mp=115002 | title=Network: First Stage | publisher= ''Department of Rapid Transit Systems'' | date=2010-03-18 | accessdate=2010-06-12 }} *December 30, 2000: The section between [[Taipei City Hall Station|Taipei City Hall]]-[[Kunyang Station|Kunyang]] began service. *December 28, 2008: [[Nangang Station|Nangang]] opened for commercial service. *February 27, 2011: [[Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center Station|Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center]] opened for commercial service.{{cite news|url=http://focustaiwan.tw/ShowNews/WebNews_Detail.aspx?ID=201102240036&Type=aLIV|title=MRT Nangang extension to start operations|publisher=Focus Taiwan News Channel|date=2011-02-24|accessdate=2011-02-24}} The Nangang Line Eastern Extension, which connects the [[Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center Station|Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center]] Station to the Neihu Line, was opened for service on February 27, 2010. ==Stations== {| class=wikitable !rowspan=2|Code!!colspan=2|Station Name !rowspan=2|Transfer !rowspan=2 colspan=2|Location |-
